lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the French word for "go on", Allez. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Allez/Allez.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Allez.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I do for you?
Allez is a desktop app for managing your tasks via a Command Line Interface (CLI).
> - Words in `UPPER_CASE` are parameters to be supplied by users.
> e.g in `todo DESCRIPTION`, `DESCRIPTION` is a parameter which can be used as `todo math homework`.
> - Words that begin with a `/` needs to be supplied by user.
> e.g in `deadline DESCRIPTION /by BY`, `/by` is required for the command.
> - Extraneous parameters for commands that do not take in parameters (such as help, list, exit and clear) will be ignored.
e.g. if the command specifies help 123, it will be interpreted as help.

> - If you are using a PDF version of this document, be careful when copying and pasting commands that span multiple lines as space characters surrounding line-breaks may be omitted when copied over to the application.
There are three types of tasks you can add.
Adds a ToDo task to the list of tasks.
Adds a Deadline task to the list of tasks. Deadline has a specified end time.
Adds an Event task to the list of tasks. Events have a specified start and end time.
- `event NUS Open House /from Saturday morning /to Saturday night`
Shows a list of all tasks recorded.
- Marks the task at the corresponding `INDEX`.
- The index refers to the index number shown next to displayed task list.
Deletes a task from the list.
- Marks the task at the corresponding `INDEX`.
- The index refers to the index number shown next to displayed task list.
> Deleting a task will shift the index of the tasks below it.
Find all tasks that contains the keyword in its description.
- The search is case-sensitive. e.g `CS2113` will not match `cs2113`.
- Only the description of tasks is searched
List of tasks are saved in the hard disk automatically upon entering `bye`.
* Entry point of the Allez Chatbot Application
* Initialises the application and start interactions with the user.
* Save the current list of tasks into the save file. Prints out the exit message.
* Set up required objects, load data from the save file if there is any.
* @param line line input from the user
* @return true if command received is "bye", false otherwise
private static boolean executeCommands(String command, String line) {

* Create a task to be added into the task list
* @param type the type of task to be added: ToDo, Deadline, Event

System.out.println("Please input something for description and deadline");
System.out.println("Please input event for the task in a format as shown below");
System.out.println("Please input something for description, from and to");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");

* Able to load and save data.
* When object is initialised, store location of save file into object.

* Print hyphens to act as divider.
* Deadline are tasks that have a specific end timing, noted as /by.

* Returns all the details of the task as a string.

* Event are tasks that have a specific start and end timing, noted as /from and /to.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

* Returns all the details of the task as a string.

* An abstract class that is inherited by ToDo, Deadline and Event.
* Stores description of task and whether the task is done.
* Returns a String of symbols to show whether the task has been marked as done.

* Returns the status and description of the task as a string.

* Returns the description of the task.
* ToDo are tasks without a time period designated.
* Returns all the details of the task as a string.
* @return task type, task status and task description
